newsitem.title: USA: NY precious metals called to open lower.
newsitem.headline: NY precious metals called to open lower.

text.p: COMEX and NYMEX precious metals futures were expected to open lower Tuesday despite a slip in the dollar overnight, after more Australian gold producer hedging and news U.S. miner Newmont Gold Corp had completed a 1.1 million ounce buy back of a gold hedge.
COMEX December gold, now the active contract, was called down $0.50 to a $1.00 from Monday's close of $333.40 an ounce.
In the bullion market, spot gold was quoted at $327.50/00 early compared to the London morning fix of $327.50 and the New York close Monday of $328.50/00.
COMEX warehouse gold stocks rose 67,437 ounces Monday to 919,760 ounces, while COMEX silver stocks rose 840,945 ounces to 173,066,361 ounces.
COMEX September silver was called unchanged to down 0.5 cent from Monday's close of $4.358.
Platinum-group futures surged even higher on TOCOM overnight as shortcovering continued, but NYMEX platinum and palladium were called to open lower after more spot sales of PGMs by Russia.
NYMEX October platinum and September palladium were called down $1.00 to $2.00 from Monday's closes of $425.30 and $193.60, respectively.
